FuncDef: The reset counters interface suppression command deletes Layer 2 traffic suppression statistics on an interface.
CLIs: reset counters interface { <interface-name> | <interface-type> <interface-num> } suppression [ vlan <vlanid> | bd <bd-id> ]

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies a VSI name.
The value is a string of 1 to 31 characters.

Specifies a VLAN ID.
The value is an integer ranging from 1 to 4094.

Specifies a BDID.
The value is an integer ranging from 1 to 16777215.

Examples: <HUAWEI> reset counters interface GigabitEthernet 1/0/0.1 suppression bd 1
ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
To delete statistics about Layer 2 traffic suppression on an interface, run the reset counters interface suppression command.
In VPLS scenarios, only AC-side traffic suppression statistics can be deleted. This command applies to GE sub-interfaces and Eth-Trunk sub-interfaces in VPLS scenarios.In VLAN scenarios, this command applies to GE main interfaces and Eth-Trunk main interfaces.In BD scenarios, only traffic suppression statistics on BD member interfaces can be deleted. This command applies to GE sub-interfaces and Eth-Trunk sub-interfaces in BD scenarios.
